is there a way to make a slider bar that's "sticky" or requires people to "pull" on it by pushing the right arrow key longer or dragging it repeatedly till it get's all the way to the end. The idea is to incentivize people not to click "5 stars yay" and to really see how much they "mean it" by how long they'd be willing to wait, or how many times they scroll to the right/left of a feedback bar. 
let's make it on our own, can you give me an HTML page and javascript code to demonstrate a slider with that sticky proprty, The number shoul dbe displayed, it should start at 0 and go from 0 to negative five and positive five. You can't simply slide it all the way one or the other, it should take effort, sliding it more and more sort of like an asymptotic effort, so you never reallllly get to 5, it might stop at 4.999999999 etc. display the current number

it should be easy to move it in the 0 to 1  range and then start getting exponentially harder
and can you put it all in one file?
it's not sticky or getting harder at all
